instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165A: What is 820-00165A? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PM_DSW_PWRGD: What is PM_DSW_PWRGD? The "PM_DSW_PWRGD" signal in a MacBook stands for "Deep Sleep Well Power Good” and is required for the machine to power on & post..
definitions.PM_RSMRST_L: What is PM_RSMRST_L? The "PM_RSMRST_L" signal, also known as "Resume Reset," is an active-low signal that is part of the power management system in MacBooks. It asserts a reset signal when it is low voltage which is what the _L is for. Is the machine is in a reset stage it will not properly power on..
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PCH_DSWVRMEN:
What is PCH_DSWVRMEN? DSWVRMEN stands for DeepSx Well On-Die Voltage Regulator Enable. This signal enables the internal DSW 1.05 V regulators and must be always pulled-up to PPVRTC_G3H 3.3 volts.
If this signal is not being asserted (i.e., not enabled), the on-die voltage regulators responsible for supplying power in deep sleep states may not be active. This could lead to the MacBook failing to exit from a deep sleep state or having issues when trying to enter one, contributing to a scenario where the device does not power on.

If the signal is not present or not at the correct levels, it could indicate a problem with the Platform Controller Hub (PCH) itself..
definitions.S5_PWRGD: What is S5_PWRGD? The S5_PWRGD signal is a status signal that indicates the S5 rails are on and functioning properly. If this is not present, check the S5 rails to see if they are functioning, and the chip that creates S5_PWRGD..
definitions.PM_SLP_S4L: What is PM_SLP_S4L? This is a typo of PM_SLP_S4_L When you see PM_SLP_S4L, assume they meant to type PM_SLP_S4_L.
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PCH_INTRUDER_L: What is PCH_INTRUDER_L? PCH_INTRUDER_L is a signal that tells the machine the case has been opened by an intruder when it is low, the _L means it is present when it is low. This signal should always be high in a Macbook since it doesn’t use intrusion detection. .
definitions.RTC_RESET_L: What is RTC_RESET_L? RTC_RESET_L is a reset signal that is present when the signal is low, the _L means it is asserted when the voltage is low. The RESET signal will keep the PCH from turning on or booting up the machine. .
definitions.PCH_SRTCRST_L: What is PCH_SRTCRST_L? PCH_SRTCRST_L is a reset signal present for the RTC circuit that asserts when it is low in voltage, that is what _L means..
definitions.PCH_INTVRMEN:
What is PCH_INTVRMEN? PCH_INTVRMEN is an Internal Voltage Regulator Enable: When pulled high, this signal enables
the internal 1.05 V regulators for the Suspend well in the PCH. This signal must
remain asserted for the VRMs to behave properly (no glitches allowed).
This signal must be pulled-up to VCCRTC on desktop platforms and may
optionally be pulled low on mobile platforms if using an external VR for the
VCCSUS rail.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message:
Come with busted lvds connector, so I just remove it first, no green light, I already used known good i/o flex and dc in connector
ppbus 8.6v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.4v
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 3.4v
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> is shorted ( or its resistance is just so low, so the multimere beep ? no clue here )
even its shorted, do shorted ppvcc matter with me not having green light or not ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message:
Be aware DMMs beep until 0.060-0.075, depending of model.
You probably get around 010-020, which is not short.

The two chips for <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> from LIO board are very easy to locate.
Check <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> level and continuity.
Inspect LIO connector from MLB; ussually 3V42, or <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> pins get corroded.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message:
j9500 looks clean, Im sorry I don understand which two chips you mean..
how do I check the continuity of <SIGNAL>SYS_ONE</SIGNAL> wire ? probe pin 19 of j9500 to the smc ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message:
looks like all clean, so I suspect the smc, give it a reball, and I got orange light now, but still doesnt turn on
no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: I don have <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> too, when i plug inthe magsafe, it become shorted

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message:
"when i plug inthe magsafe, it become shorted"
I bet you measured diode mode (or ohm scale) with power aapplied.
Do NOT do that again!

Missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4L</SIGNAL> too?
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>?
Check if board starts without LIO flex connected.
Also try to start in SMC bypass mode.
Post <SIGNAL>S5_PWRGD</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_RSMRST_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PCH_DSWVRMEN</SIGNAL>.
Check all (4) RTC signals.
Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> (use <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/16 pads) and check for drop pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> at same time.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message:
yeah I have <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>
I cannot reset smc,, ( the orange light doesnt change to green)
board doesnt turn on with LIO flex
<SIGNAL>S5_PWRGD</SIGNAL> = 3.28v
<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> = 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PM_RSMRST_L</SIGNAL> = 3.08v
<SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL> =3.4V
<SIGNAL>PCH_DSWVRMEN</SIGNAL> = 0V
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.3v
sorry I don undertsand 4 rtc signal..
when I trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ON_OFF_L</SIGNAL> , <SIGNAL>PM_PWR_BTN_L</SIGNAL> drop from 3.3 to 0.3 v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PCH_DSWVRMEN</SIGNAL> = 0V
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.3v"
Check <RESISTOR>R1450</RESISTOR> if broken.
If not, bad PCH...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message:
Force <RESISTOR>R1450</RESISTOR> with 100k, instead of 330k.
If still low, bad PCH...

Just in case, you can still try to heat it with good flux.

Do you think is good???
Force 200-330k at <RESISTOR>R1301</RESISTOR>, instead of 1M.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message:
the <RESISTOR>R1301</RESISTOR> is already 200 to begin with, so I change it to 100, and I have 3.3v at <SIGNAL>PCH_INTRUDER_L</SIGNAL>
i change <RESISTOR>R1302</RESISTOR> to 10k too, now I have 3.3v too at <SIGNAL>PCH_INTVRMEN</SIGNAL>,

time to move to other power rail ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PCH_INTVRMEN</SIGNAL> was good already.

<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> still not pulsing when trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>?
As you had two PCH lines with problems, looks like bad PCH.
You can try heating it with good flux; to burn eventually accumulated crap between balls.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light
threads.message: still not pulsing, tried heating with flux and 500celcius, still doesn't work, time to throw the blanket i think, thankss
